notes.body: Hello Asraf,     Greetings from PharmEasy!    With regards to your order #657686505304915968-59116, I understand your concern regarding the order. I will surely assist you with the same.  As per the records, your order was cancelled on 11th December 2025. I apologise for any inconvenience caused to you with your order.     I see the requested medicine, OLSAR 10MG STRIP OF 10 TABLETS, was unavailable with our partner retailer.   ​   Please note that at the time of placing the order, the requested medicine was available in limited quantity, and you were able to add medicines to the order. Once the medicine was added to your order, our Partner Retailer tried to arrange the medicine from every possible source.   I request you to place a new order after 7 days for the required medicine. As our retailer restocks the medicines every 7 days. If the medicine is still unavailable, I would request that you reach out to us. We will highlight your concern to the Partner retailer.     I see the refund of Rs. 1660.67 was initiated on 11th December 2025. It will be credited to your original payment source within 3 to 5 working days from the date of initiation. You can track your refund via ARN number: 571103535228.     Please note: Saturday, Sunday, and public holidays will not be included in business days. Refund timelines depend on Bank turnaround times. I appreciate your patience and understanding in the meantime.     For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the Need Help section. Alternatively, you can also call us on 08071324888.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy!     Regards,  Habiba

Greetings from PharmEasy!
​
I understand your concern is regarding the medicine deleted from your order. 

With regards to your order #657094799215366144-42062, I see that the requested medicines SYLOR 5MG STRIP OF 10 TABLETS (3 quantities) and APREZO 20MG STRIP OF 4 TABLETS (3 quantities) were unavailable with our partner retailer. Hence, they had to be removed in order to proceed with the remaining items in your order.

​The refund amount of Rs. 509.45 was initiated on 11th December 2025, and it will be reflected in your payment source account within 5 to 7 business days (Excluding Saturday, Sunday & Bank Holidays). Request you to check with your bank's customer care with the help of the ARN number (534507636964).

Please note, at the time of placing the order, the requested medicine was available in limited quantity, and you were able to add medicines to the order. Once the medicine was added to your order, our Partner Retailer tried to arrange the medicine from every possible source.

I request you to place a new order after 7 days for the required medicine. As our retailer restocks the medicines every 7 days. If the medicine is still unavailable, I would request that you reach out to us. We will highlight your concern to the Partner retailer.

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.

notes.body: Hello Naved,     Greetings from PharmEasy!  With regards to your order #657811466093854720-80547, I see the requested medicine MINTOP ALCOHOL FREE 5% BOTTLE OF 60ML SOLUTION was unavailable with our partner retailer. Hence, it was replaced with MINTOP FORTE 5% MINOXIDIL BOTTLE OF 60ML SOLUTION as a packaging variant to fulfil your requirements.  I assure you that this change in your order has occurred only if the Partner Retailer has exhausted all possible alternatives to source the unavailable medicine.     I request you to place a new order after 7 days for the required medicine. As our retailer restocks the medicines every 7 days. If the medicine is still unavailable, I would request that you reach out to us. We will highlight your concern to the Partner retailer.  As checked, a return request is already raised for the wrong MINTOP FORTE 5% MINOXIDIL BOTTLE OF 60ML SOLUTION on 11th December 2025. Please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused.  Please be informed that items that are opened, partially used, or disfigured are not eligible for returns. Items being returned should be in their original manufacturer’s packaging with labels and barcode intact.  The medicines will be collected within 24 hours from the day the request is raised. Once the medicine is returned, it will be verified by our partner retailer at the store. The refund amount of Rs. 917.50 will be processed and initiated within 48 hours. Also, once the refund is initiated, it will reflect in your PharmEasy wallet in 24 hours.  I appreciate your patience in the meantime.    For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the Need Help section. Alternatively, you can also call us on 08071324888.   Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy!   Regards,  Habiba

notes.body: Hello Shivam,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     Please be informed that we are unable to comply with his request to erase the data. We have to produce/show any or all transactions or interactions, past or present, when asked for by relevant government authorities. However, please confirm if you wish to deactivate your account.     Let me inform you that once the account is deactivated, we cannot process any requests or reactivate the account. Once confirmed, our team will reach out to complete the account deactivation process on the registered mobile number to confirm if you requested account deactivation.      If yes, OTP will be generated and will be sent to your registered mobile number. Once the OTP is shared by you with the team, they will go ahead and block the customer's account.      Awaiting your response.     Regards,  Sandhya Nackwal

notes.body: Hello Ankita,     Greetings from PharmEasy!  ​   ​With regards to your order #658010397042610176-79538, I see your order is under process and the medicines are being arranged. Also, be informed that PharmEasy will always try to ensure that your order is delivered at the earliest as we completely understand the urgency of the medicine.  ​ Your order will be delivered within the estimated delivery date committed at the time of order placement. Your patience and understanding are highly appreciated in the meantime.  ​   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Manisha

notes.body: Hello Govinda,     Greetings from PharmEasy!      With regards to your order #650001957789757440-81799, I understand you want to return the medicine. As per your request, I have raised a return request for TFCT NIB 5MG STRIP OF 15 TABLETS of 3 quantity.    Please be informed, items that are opened, partially used, or disfigured are not eligible for returns. Items being returned should be in their original manufacturer’s packaging with labels and barcode intact.   Please note that the medicine will be collected within 48 hours from the day the request is raised. Once the medicine is returned, it will be verified by our partner retailer at the store. The refund will be processed and initiated within 5 working days. Also, once the refund is initiated it would reflect in your payment source within 5 - 7 business days.   I appreciate your patience in the meantime.        For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.   Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Neeha

notes.body: Hello Linu,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to your order #658147699089805312-69798, I see your order has been completed with a doctor consultation and confirmation call, and the medicine is being arranged. The estimated delivery date for your order is between  14th December 2025 - 16th December 2025.       I would like to inform you that the estimated date of delivery depends on the availability of the medicines and the delivery pin code. Also, be informed that PharmEasy will always try to ensure that your order is delivered at the earliest as we completely understand the urgency of the medicine.     Also, I noticed the requested medicine, TIOMATE HFA 180MD BOX OF 11.7GM TRANSHALER , is limited in stock. our Partner Retailer is trying to arrange from other distributors as its stock has been exhausted. The expected time to get medicines arranged is 13th December 2025 O7:00 AM.     However, you have the option to delete the unavailable medicine to avoid further delays in the delivery. Or you can wait till the medicines are being arranged.     Please confirm if you wish to delete the said medicine. If the said medicine is deleted, there is a possibility that there might be some changes in the delivery charges and/or the promo code if applied.      Awaiting your earliest response.     Regards,  Tahera

notes.body_html:
Hello Harish,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #657633727915229184-86772, I see your order has been out for delivery. The estimated delivery date is 14th December 2025.

I would like to inform you that the estimated date of delivery depends on the availability of the medicines and the delivery pin code. Also, be informed, PharmEasy will always try to ensure that your order is delivered at the earliest, as we completely understand the urgency of the medicine.

​Once your order is out for delivery, the delivery person will contact you. You can coordinate with them regarding the exact timing.

You can also track your order on the link below with the help of the AWB no. 

Link: https://www.shiprocket.in/shipment-tracking/
AWB: 152785856533704 

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the Need Help section. Alternatively, you can also call us on 8071324888.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy.

Regards,
Tahera

notes.body_html:
Hello Vishal,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

This email is with regards to your order #656353020560084992-64716,  as checked your concern was regarding missing medicine and the same highlighted. We apologize for any inconvenience caused to you with your order.

As per update received from our team, please be informed that an issue was raised for the missing SITAGLO 100MG STRIP OF 15 TABLETS . As checked, the issue is verified and a refund of Rs. 1117.8 /- has been initiated on 12 December 2025 and the same will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. We appreciate your patience in the meantime.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

On Thu, Aug 21, 2025 at 8:51 PM Namo Dogra <namo.dogra@aarman.in> wrote:
Hi Grievance Redressal Team,

Please go through the below response and confirm the details before sending it out to the customer:

____________________

Without prejudice, this is with reference to your complaint number [___]. We truly regret the inconvenience you may have experienced and would like to respond to your concerns.

We would like to respectfully reiterate that “PharmEasy” acts as a facilitator for the sale of pharmaceutical products and healthcare services. The Company and the Platform operate solely as intermediaries, connecting the Users and the registered Sellers of the products and services through its mobile application and website.This arrangement, including the limitations of our responsibility, is clearly outlined in our Terms and Conditions, available at https://pharmeasy.in/legal/terms-and-conditions.

Our platform enables you to purchase pharmaceutical products, nutraceuticals, and services offered by third-party retail pharmacies ("Retail Pharmacies"). The products once ordered are duly handed over by the Retail Pharmacies to our third-party logistics partner (“Delivery Partner”). We do not exercise direct control over the function of the Retail Pharmacies and Delivery Partner. PharmEasy’s role is limited to providing hosting services and technological support, facilitating the connection between users and these Retail Pharmacies.

Despite these limitations, we have consistently taken active steps to assist you and resolve your concerns in a timely and fair manner. After your initial grievance, we attempted to coordinate the delivery of your medicines. Further we also processed a full refund of the product amount directly to your source account. Additionally, as a token of goodwill and to ensure customer satisfaction, we have also offered an additional goodwill refund of ₹2,000 (Rupees Two Thousand Only), reflecting our genuine effort to provide you with resolution. This amount is ready to be processed as soon as you share your bank account details for the transfer. We assure you that we remain fully committed to closing this matter respectfully. We have also connected with the relevant stakeholders to ensure that you have a smooth ordering experience in future.

While we understand your concerns, we respectfully submit that PharmEasy's involvement has been limited to its intermediary role. Please consider that we have not dismissed your concerns and have engaged with them constructively offering solutions within the scope of our operational role as an intermediary.

As highlighted in our previous responses, we hold our customers in the highest regard. In line with this commitment, we once again request you to kindly confirm your preferred bank account details at your convenience so that we may proceed with the pending ₹2,000 (Rupees Two Thousand Only) refund without any further delay. Should you prefer to receive the product ordered by you, we will be glad to initiate the delivery upon your confirmation.

Thank you for your patience so far. We value your association with PharmEasy and remain available to assist you should you have any further concerns.
______________________________________________________________________

Best Regards,
Namo Dogra

Summary of the issues so far.

1. 594888562692067328-77026
FL1167140104
Order Placed - 20th Jun, 08:03 AM
Delivered - 20th Jun, 05:00 PM
This same issue happened, and the wrong item was delivered. We collected the items manually, and the refund of Rs. 1322.44 was made to the Cx bank account. A new order was placed, and the medicines were delivered free of cost. We had credited Rs. 1322.44 to the PharmEasy wallet to place an order for the same.


2. 610096008386125824-77916
FL1170880452
Order Placed - 1st Aug, 07:12 AM
Delivered - 2nd Aug, 08:11 PM
This same issue happened, and the wrong item was delivered. A refund of Rs.  995.95 was made to the Cx bank account. A new order was placed free of cost. We had credited Rs. 1200 to the PharmEasy wallet to place an order for the same. Attempts were made to deliver the order and to collect the wrong items from Cx, but it failed as the Cx was not available at the address. The free-of-cost order was cancelled, and Rs. 1200 was refunded to the PharmEasy wallet. Cx had later used that amount to place an order.
Additionally, we offered Rs. 2000 as compensation and asked Cx to provide the bank details to proceed, which Cx did not agree to, as he was not ready with that amount.

3. Current latest order #656531285027880960-50248
FL1182446824
Order Placed - 7th Dec, 10:29 AM
Delivered - 8th Dec, 04:17 PM

This same issue has happened again. We have now raised a return request.
Amount paid - Rs. 1788.21

Kindly confirm further actions.







Regards,

The Company and the Platform operate solely as intermediaries, connecting the Users and the registered Sellers of the products and services through its mobile application and website.This arrangement, including the limitations of our responsibility, is clearly outlined in our Terms and Conditions, available at https://pharmeasy.in/legal/terms-and-conditions.

Our platform enables you to purchase pharmaceutical products, nutraceuticals, and services offered by third-party retail pharmacies ("Retail Pharmacies"). The products once ordered are duly handed over by the Retail Pharmacies to our third-party logistics partner (“Delivery Partner”). We do not exercise direct control over the function of the Retail Pharmacies and Delivery Partner. PharmEasy’s role is limited to providing hosting services and technological support, facilitating the connection between users and these Retail Pharmacies.

Despite these limitations, we have consistently taken active steps to assist you and resolve your concerns in a timely and fair manner. After your initial grievance, we attempted to coordinate the delivery of your medicines. Further we also processed a full refund of the product amount directly to your source account. Additionally, as a token of goodwill and to ensure customer satisfaction, we have also offered an additional goodwill refund of ₹2,000 (Rupees Two Thousand Only), reflecting our genuine effort to provide you with resolution. This amount is ready to be processed as soon as you share your bank account details for the transfer. We assure you that we remain fully committed to closing this matter respectfully. We have also connected with the relevant stakeholders to ensure that you have a smooth ordering experience in future.

While we understand your concerns, we respectfully submit that PharmEasy's involvement has been limited to its intermediary role. Please consider that we have not dismissed your concerns and have engaged with them constructively offering solutions within the scope of our operational role as an intermediary.

As highlighted in our previous responses, we hold our customers in the highest regard. In line with this commitment, we once again request you to kindly confirm your preferred bank account details at your convenience so that we may proceed with the pending ₹2,000 (Rupees Two Thousand Only) refund without any further delay. Should you prefer to receive the product ordered by you, we will be glad to initiate the delivery upon your confirmation.

Thank you for your patience so far. We value your association with PharmEasy and remain available to assist you should you have any further concerns.
______________________________________________________________________

Best Regards,
Namo Dogra

Hi Chetan and Deepak,

We had previously highlighted this issue and were assured that the matter
had been fully rectified and that adequate measures had been implemented to
ensure it would not recur. Despite these assurances, *the same issue has
re-arisen with the very same customer, which is a matter of serious
concern. Also, it becomes challenging to respond to such complaints which
re-occurs again and again. *

[image: Screenshot 2025-12-17 120620.png]

This recurrence *clearly indicates gaps in the corrective actions*,
particularly with respect *to staff training for making entries and the
order verification/double-checking mechanism prior to dispensation.
Immediate and effective steps need to be taken to address these
deficiencies.*

Please note that this lapse has serious commercial and legal implications.
The* customer is now demanding compensation of ₹6,50,000, and the matter
carries a high risk of potential litigation, which could have significant
consequences for all parties involved.*

You are therefore required to:

   1. Provide the warning to the respective stakeholder involved in this
   process and conduct immediate training for all relevant personnel (if
   applicable);
   2. Implement and strictly enforce a robust double-check and validation
   mechanism before order fulfillment;
   3. Share a written confirmation detailing the corrective and preventive
   actions taken to ensure this issue does not recur.

*We expect an urgent resolution and a clear action plan at the
earliest, post which we shall be responding to the customer with proper
resolution. Please note that the issue is time sensitive hence would expect
your prompt response. You may add in the relevant stakeholder to the email
trail to ensure swift resolution and corrective actions.*

Best Regards,
Namo Dogra

notes.body_html:
Hi Chetan and Deepak,

We had previously highlighted this issue and were assured that the matter had been fully rectified and that adequate measures had been implemented to ensure it would not recur. Despite these assurances, the same issue has re-arisen with the very same customer, which is a matter of serious concern. Also, it becomes challenging to respond to such complaints which re-occurs again and again. 



This recurrence clearly indicates gaps in the corrective actions, particularly with respect to staff training for making entries and the order verification/double-checking mechanism prior to dispensation. Immediate and effective steps need to be taken to address these deficiencies.

Please note that this lapse has serious commercial and legal implications. The customer is now demanding compensation of ₹6,50,000, and the matter carries a high risk of potential litigation, which could have significant consequences for all parties involved.

You are therefore required to:
  1. Provide the warning to the respective stakeholder involved in this process and conduct immediate training for all relevant personnel (if applicable);
  2. Implement and strictly enforce a robust double-check and validation mechanism before order fulfillment;
  3. Share a written confirmation detailing the corrective and preventive actions taken to ensure this issue does not recur.
We expect an urgent resolution and a clear action plan at the earliest, post which we shall be responding to the customer with proper resolution. Please note that the issue is time sensitive hence would expect your prompt response. You may add in the relevant stakeholder to the email trail to ensure swift resolution and corrective actions.

Best Regards,
Namo Dogra

notes.body:
Hi Jobin,

Once we receive a response from the warehouse team we may send the below
response to the customer. Kindly confirm and insert the details (were
required) mentioned in the response before sending it out to the customer.
_________

Dear [Customer Name],

We are writing with reference to your complaint dated <> concerning Order
No. <>. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience that might have caused
to you, and we truly appreciate your patience in bringing this matter to
our attention.

PharmEasy (“we”, “our”) operates as an e-commerce marketplace that connects
customers with third-party retail pharmacies (“Retail Pharmacies”). While
we provide the technology platform and facilitate order placement, the
products are supplied and dispensed by the Retail Pharmacies. That said,
your experience is important to us. Upon receiving your complaint, we
immediately initiated a detailed review with the concerned Retail Pharmacy
and relevant stakeholders to identify the root cause of the issue. As part
of our resolution below actions as been taken from our end:

   -

   The full refund for the order has already been processed and credited to
   your original payment source.
   -

   A goodwill refund of Rs. 1000  has already been credited to your
   PharmEasy Wallet.

   -

   The concerned stakeholders have been issued warnings and instructed to
   verify orders thoroughly prior to dispensation.

   -

   The matter has been escalated for additional training and quality checks
   to prevent recurrence.

To ensure you receive your required medication without further delay, we
are ready upon your confirmation to place a fresh order for:


1)  ___ strips of DIANORM M OD 1000MG (strip of __ tablets) (Reference
Order No. #656531285027880960-50248). Additionally, as a gesture of
goodwill and in recognition of the inconvenience caused, we are offering an
additional goodwill compensation of ₹2,000 (Rupees Two Thousand Only). This
amount will be processed immediately upon receipt of your bank account
details.

2) Further, with respect to Order No. #610096008386125824-77916, the refund
was already completed, and a goodwill compensation of ₹2,000 was offered
earlier. As we did not receive confirmation at that time, the amount could
not be processed. We had to ensure customer satisfaction credited Rs. 1,
200 to your PharmEasy wallet which was duly used by you.

Please be assured that we have taken this matter seriously and have
coordinated closely with the relevant stakeholders to help ensure a
smoother experience for you going forward. While our role is limited to
that of an intermediary, we remain committed to resolving customer concerns
promptly and responsibly.

We hope this resolution addresses your concerns satisfactorily. We value
your trust and look forward to serving you better in the future.
Warm regards,
PharmEasy
___________________________________________________________

Best Regards,
Namo Dogra

Hi Jobin,

Once we receive a response from the warehouse team we may send the below response to the customer. Kindly confirm and insert the details (were required) mentioned in the response before sending it out to the customer.
_________
Dear [Customer Name],
We are writing with reference to your complaint dated <> concerning Order No. <>. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience that might have caused to you, and we truly appreciate your patience in bringing this matter to our attention.
PharmEasy (“we”, “our”) operates as an e-commerce marketplace that connects customers with third-party retail pharmacies (“Retail Pharmacies”). While we provide the technology platform and facilitate order placement, the products are supplied and dispensed by the Retail Pharmacies. That said, your experience is important to us. Upon receiving your complaint, we immediately initiated a detailed review with the concerned Retail Pharmacy and relevant stakeholders to identify the root cause of the issue. As part of our resolution below actions as been taken from our end:
  • The full refund for the order has already been processed and credited to your original payment source. 
  • A goodwill refund of Rs. 1000  has already been credited to your PharmEasy Wallet.
  • The concerned stakeholders have been issued warnings and instructed to verify orders thoroughly prior to dispensation.
  • The matter has been escalated for additional training and quality checks to prevent recurrence.
To ensure you receive your required medication without further delay, we are ready upon your confirmation to place a fresh order for:

1)  ___ strips of DIANORM M OD 1000MG (strip of __ tablets) (Reference Order No. #656531285027880960-50248). Additionally, as a gesture of goodwill and in recognition of the inconvenience caused, we are offering an additional goodwill compensation of ₹2,000 (Rupees Two Thousand Only). This amount will be processed immediately upon receipt of your bank account details.
2) Further, with respect to Order No. #610096008386125824-77916, the refund was already completed, and a goodwill compensation of ₹2,000 was offered earlier. As we did not receive confirmation at that time, the amount could not be processed. We had to ensure customer satisfaction credited Rs. 1, 200 to your PharmEasy wallet which was duly used by you.
Please be assured that we have taken this matter seriously and have coordinated closely with the relevant stakeholders to help ensure a smoother experience for you going forward. While our role is limited to that of an intermediary, we remain committed to resolving customer concerns promptly and responsibly.
We hope this resolution addresses your concerns satisfactorily. We value your trust and look forward to serving you better in the future.
Warm regards,
PharmEasy
___________________________________________________________

Best Regards,
Namo Dogra

On Wed, Dec 17, 2025 at 12:35 PM Namo Dogra <namo.dogra@aarman.in> wrote:
Hi Chetan and Deepak,

We had previously highlighted this issue and were assured that the matter had been fully rectified and that adequate measures had been implemented to ensure it would not recur. Despite these assurances, the same issue has re-arisen with the very same customer, which is a matter of serious concern. Also, it becomes challenging to respond to such complaints which re-occurs again and again. 



This recurrence clearly indicates gaps in the corrective actions, particularly with respect to staff training for making entries and the order verification/double-checking mechanism prior to dispensation. Immediate and effective steps need to be taken to address these deficiencies.

Please note that this lapse has serious commercial and legal implications. The customer is now demanding compensation of ₹6,50,000, and the matter carries a high risk of potential litigation, which could have significant consequences for all parties involved.

You are therefore required to:
  1. Provide the warning to the respective stakeholder involved in this process and conduct immediate training for all relevant personnel (if applicable);
  2. Implement and strictly enforce a robust double-check and validation mechanism before order fulfillment;
  3. Share a written confirmation detailing the corrective and preventive actions taken to ensure this issue does not recur.
We expect an urgent resolution and a clear action plan at the earliest, post which we shall be responding to the customer with proper resolution. Please note that the issue is time sensitive hence would expect your prompt response. You may add in the relevant stakeholder to the email trail to ensure swift resolution and corrective actions.

Best Regards,
Namo Dogra

Our platform enables you to purchase pharmaceutical products, nutraceuticals, and services offered by third-party retail pharmacies ("Retail Pharmacies"). The products once ordered are duly handed over by the Retail Pharmacies to our third-party logistics partner (“Delivery Partner”). We do not exercise direct control over the function of the Retail Pharmacies and Delivery Partner. PharmEasy’s role is limited to providing hosting services and technological support, facilitating the connection between users and these Retail Pharmacies.

Despite these limitations, we have consistently taken active steps to assist you and resolve your concerns in a timely and fair manner. After your initial grievance, we attempted to coordinate the delivery of your medicines. Further we also processed a full refund of the product amount directly to your source account. Additionally, as a token of goodwill and to ensure customer satisfaction, we have also offered an additional goodwill refund of ₹2,000 (Rupees Two Thousand Only), reflecting our genuine effort to provide you with resolution. This amount is ready to be processed as soon as you share your bank account details for the transfer. We assure you that we remain fully committed to closing this matter respectfully. We have also connected with the relevant stakeholders to ensure that you have a smooth ordering experience in future.

While we understand your concerns, we respectfully submit that PharmEasy's involvement has been limited to its intermediary role. Please consider that we have not dismissed your concerns and have engaged with them constructively offering solutions within the scope of our operational role as an intermediary.

As highlighted in our previous responses, we hold our customers in the highest regard. In line with this commitment, we once again request you to kindly confirm your preferred bank account details at your convenience so that we may proceed with the pending ₹2,000 (Rupees Two Thousand Only) refund without any further delay. Should you prefer to receive the product ordered by you, we will be glad to initiate the delivery upon your confirmation.

Thank you for your patience so far. We value your association with PharmEasy and remain available to assist you should you have any further concerns.
______________________________________________________________________

Best Regards,

notes.body: Hello Mukadam,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to your order #656559439727185920-35176, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.     As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 12th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.      We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.     For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.      Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!     Regards,  PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Mukadam,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #656559439727185920-35176, as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.

As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 12th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future. 

We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

On Sun, Dec 7, 2025 at 12:45 PM Sachin Kistappa <sachin.kistappa@aarman.in> wrote:
Hi Afrin 

We usually do not deliver an order if the parcel is damaged or not in intact condition. At the time of receipt, the shipment weight was captured as 500 grams, and if this matches, we proceed accordingly. For safety purposes, we have asked the partner to confirm if any mishap occurred. Kindly allow us some time; we will update you shortly after our investigation.


Warm regards 
Sachin Kistappa
Courier Team 

On Sun, Dec 7, 2025 at 12:24 PM Afrin Sayyed <afrin.sayyed@aarman.in> wrote:
+Sachin Kistappa +Courier team Can we have an update on this?

Warm Regards,
Afrin Sayyed.
 


On Thu, Dec 4, 2025 at 3:14 PM Nadeem Lohar <nadeem.lohar@aarman.in> wrote:
The customer has raised a complaint, He received the wrong medicine in a parcel. He ordered a total of 5 medicines but received 2 which were wrong, We checked with a warehouse. All the medicine was packed properly. Kindly check it from your end. Is there any issue while in transit or delivery ??

Order id #653726198280949760-89430
AWB number #BSRP2702696659

--
Regards,
Nadeem Lohar
( Pharmeasy )

We have received an update from our Logistics team that your order has been delivered to you. We hope you have received the same today. We apologise for the inconvenience caused to you and hope to serve you better ahead.    For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section. Hello Sakina,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

This email is in regard to order #657774247870201856-25729.

We have received an update from our Logistics team that your order has been delivered to you. We hope you have received the same today. We apologise for the inconvenience caused to you and hope to serve you better ahead.
 
For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.

Regards,
PharmEasy
